He has an unmistakable aura of power and authority as do all men who are accustomed to being obeyed without question. In his world, his word is the law.

dlgPart.npc_text:
Rumors floating around painted Gaius Aetius Paullus as a paranoid tyrant or a benevolent despot, but the man standing in front of you appears to be neither paranoid nor benevolent.
He has an unmistakable aura of power and authority as do all men who are accustomed to being obeyed without question. In his world, his word is the law.
“What brings you here, Praetor?” asks Paullus. Something tells you he’s already figured it out, after all there is but one reason for your visit.

dlgAnsw.text: “Ganezzar.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Meru wants me to break the siege. I assume you’re here to convince me otherwise. I *assume*,” his voice hardens, “you expect me to forget the slaughter of my men at Harran’s pass.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Mistakes were made, Dux. I’ll be the first to admit it.”
“You could've marched on Maadoran the moment you got the news. You didn’t. So let’s put emotions aside and talk business.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “A mistake? Is that what it was?” asks Paullus. “What if let my men nail you to a cross and call it a mistake later? Would you be a good sport and overlook a momentary lapse in my judgment, Praetor?”

dlgAnsw.text: “Are you threatening me?”
“I would, but lord Gaelius might take it the wrong way.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“We both know that you’re enjoying my hospitality only because I want to hear what your master has to say, otherwise I would have fed you to my dogs for what you’ve done. In fact, I’m fighting the temptation to kill you as we speak, but let’s not get sidetracked.
“What does your master offer?”

dlgAnsw.text: “If you help us take Ganezzar, the Imperial Guards will become the military arm of House Aurelian. The Charter will be abolished and all restrictions placed on you will be lifted.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “What does your master offer?” Paullus asks calmly as if the question of dead soldiers was never raised.

dlgAnsw.text: “If you help us take Ganezzar, the Imperial Guards will become the military arm of House Aurelian. The Charter will be abolished and all restrictions placed on you will be lifted.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Meru wants me to break the siege. I assume you’re here to convince me otherwise. What does your master offer?”

dlgAnsw.text: “If you help us take Ganezzar, the Imperial Guards will become the military arm of House Aurelian. The Charter will be abolished and all restrictions placed on you will be lifted.”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“A fair offer,” says Paullus, showing as much emotion as if he were haggling over a cow.
“But can your master be trusted? He wants Ganezzar now and he’s willing to promise anything to make it happen. Would he still feel the same way after Ganezzar falls?”

dlgAnsw.text: “Breaking such a promise would lead to war. Do you really think that’s what my lord desires?”
“If you think it ends with Ganezzar, you’re very short-sighted. Gaelius wants to forge a new kingdom and he needs you to safeguard and expand it.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Nobody desires a war, yet our history is littered with them. I’m afraid you’ll have to do better than that, Praetor, if you want to convince me.”

dlgAnsw.text: “If you think it ends with Ganezzar, you’re very short-sighted. Gaelius wants to forge a new kingdom and he needs you to safeguard and expand it.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “So Gaelius wants us to forge him a kingdom and in exchange he'll remove the restrictions placed on us by his ancestors?”

dlgAnsw.text: “What’s the alternative? Side with Meru? Do nothing? This offer is what’s best for the Guards and everyone else.”
“In exchange he’ll elevate the Imperial Guards, making them the Imperial Army again and you the second most powerful man in the kingdom.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Except for Meru,” says Paullus, like a teacher correcting a pupil.

dlgAnsw.text: “Fuck Meru. Are you in and out?”
“You can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “And if I’d rather be the first in Caer-Tor than second in Maadoran?”

dlgAnsw.text: “Then I’m talking to the wrong man. Am I?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “I want assurances,” says Paullus after a pause.

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion]“I understand your hesitation, Dux. You wonder if the offer is real. I must confess that I was surprised myself, but I assure you that the offer is genuine. Lord Gaelius needs you. If he goes back on his deal, he will lose more than he would gain.”

[streetwise]“I’m offering you the opportunity of a lifetime – everything the Guards have ever wanted and dreamed of – and you’re afraid to seize it because you worry it might be a trap? Perhaps you've stayed in Caer-Tor way too long, Dux.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“It is said that the cautious seldom err, so you can’t fault me for not rushing into this venture. How do the Ordu fit into this picture?”

dlgAnsw.text: “If you accept the offer, the Ordu will no longer be needed. They will be yours to dispose of as you see fit.”

[persuasion]“Dux, I’m talking about the future and you’re trying to cling to the past where the Ordu are still the enemy. The khan and his men will serve the new kingdom and fight alongside your men.”
[word of honor]“I gave them my word, just like I’m giving you my word now. If you accept the offer, it will be honored.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [failure]"That's not good enough," says Paullus, shaking his head.

dlgAnsw.text: “Alright, have it your way then. If you accept the offer, the Ordu will no longer be needed. They will be yours to dispose of as you see fit.”
"It's not my decision, Dux."

dlgPart.npc_text: “We’ll take the city,” says Paullus, something in his tone suggesting that he made this decision long before this conversation started, “but you’ll lead the attack.”

dlgAnsw.text: “And if I say no?”
“Let me guess. If something goes wrong, I’ll be the first to die?”
“I thought you’d never ask.”

dlgAnsw.text: “That's not my area of expertise, Dux.”
“I thought you’d never ask.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Then give my best to your master.”

dlgAnsw.text: "Alright, I'll do it."
